checklist.title: New home checklist
checklist.subtitle: Details that make adaptation easier.
items: Protective screens on windows and balconies.
Litter box in a quiet spot.
Food bowls away from the water.
A bed or safe resting space.
Scratchers and enrichment toys.
Consistent feeding routine.
Vaccination plan and trusted vet.
Daily time for interaction and affection.

items.text: The guidance helped us choose a calm cat for our small apartment. He is family now.
We got support during adaptation and follow-up in the first weeks. It was essential.
Adopting was simple, human, and transparent. Now we have an inseparable duo at home.

items.q: Do I need experience with cats?
items.a: No. We offer full guidance for first-time adopters.

items.q: Can I adopt if I rent?
items.a: Yes, as long as pets are allowed and the home is safe.

items.q: How long does the process take?
items.a: On average 3 to 7 days, depending on the match and availability.
